page.title: 09GRAMMAR SCHOOL EDUCATION.
page.content: The system of education in{Trafford {Authority}remains that which was established by the{1944 Education Act which stresses selection at ll+. There are two boys Grammar Schools in this Survey area;{Altrincham Grammar {School}opened in l9l2 and St. Ambrose College, a Roman Catholic foundation of the Christian Brothers. Both of these schools have close links with the many{Preparatory Schools}which are so important to the area. Altrincham Grammar School for boys boasts excellent sports facilities, which include five rugby pitches and the survey team from our{Secondary Modern school were also impressed with the science labs. In l985 a scheme of reorganisation was announced by the Authority and it is proposed to merge the Girls Grammar onto this site: is this the reason for the re_decoration?
